page.title: 13GEOLOGY
page.content: As the last glaciers retreated, they left behind a thick layer of boulder clay on the lower ground, whilst the higher ground, being above the level of the ice, did not have this layer. The rocks themselves are a modified sandstone, usually called gritstone with Millstone grit being common. The geological fault at High Shores is visited quite often by geologists as it is a unique type of fault. Coal mining was common during the 19th century, with disused shafts being found on Darwen Moor in the east. The Trial Shaft near Pimms farm is thought to have been for water. Lead mines were also present in the extreme south-western area, leading down into Leadmines Valley or Limestone Clough.
